intro: Navarretia tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It produces small, elongated leaves and has a compact, low-growing habit. Navarretia tenuiflora is an annual or biennial species, depending on the region, and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
